data.title: Visit IWM North - Plan Your Visit
data.meta_description: IWM North - Plan Your Visit. Free Museum in Manchester. Exhibitions and events, real stories of war from WW1 to the present day. Great museum for kids
data.text:
IWM North’s architecture delivers an award-winning immersive experience. Walk through a timeline of history from the First World War to the present day. Explore over 2,000 objects and immerse yourself in the 360-degree cinematic Big Picture Show.

Opening Times

10am to 5pm daily.

Open every day except 24 to 26 December.

The Quays, Trafford Wharf Road, Manchester, M17 1TZ (view map)

IWM is a charity

Your support helps IWM to share powerful stories of war and conflict with current and future generations.

Discover IWM North

© Rolls Press/Popperfoto via Getty Images

The Troubles engulfed Northern Ireland in conflict for nearly 30 years. It was – and remains – a contentious period, with roots going back centuries.

Northern Ireland: Living with the Troubles invites you to understand this conflict through the multiple perspectives of those affected. On until 29 September 2024. Free Entry.

© IWM

Walk through a timeline of history from the First World War to the present day. Explore a vast collection of over 2,000 objects and stories.

Look out for our friendly and knowledgeable volunteers (wearing red uniforms) to find out what's happening onsite on the day of your visit and to help you make the most of your day.

© IWM

See Poppies, iconic hand-crafted ceramic sculptures cascading down from above.

On permanent display at IWM North, the installation is one of many artworks at IWM North created in response to war and conflict.

Families at IWM North

© IWM

Enjoy free family activities every weekend at IWM North and daily activities during the school holidays.

Exhibitions

Ukraine: Our Ordinary Lives

IWM North

Spanning the period since the 2022 invasion, IWM North’s Big Picture Show uses powerful real-life stories to highlight the experiences of 15 young Ukrainians, exploring their lives as they try to find normality, living their ordinary lives through extraordinarily challenging times.

Stories and news straight to your inbox

Hear about our collections, exhibitions, stories, events and other ways you can support us. Sign up now and enjoy a 10% discount in our IWM shop.

Share this
